item.title: Disgusting rubbish and weeds., 28th June
item.description:
The whole of the green and paths between Rancliffe gardens and south circular are a disgrace, I have to walk through here several times a week and it's been this way for some time. It needs to be addressed immediately, even the grass cutters didn't bother with is because of the rubbish.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsholm Gardens, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant overflowing bin outside school, 28th June
item.description:
The bin outside of West Horndon primary School is constantly overflowing with rubbish and dog poo bags. They are all over the street also. In current weather conditions this stinks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thorndon Avenue, West Horndon, Brentwood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wrong waste and bin bags next to blue bins remaining not collected, 28th June
item.description:
Hi, We have a recurring problem with two blue bins the become overfull with wrong waste and therefore not emptied which on a regular basis then results in additional rubbish bags being placed next to them. Which eventually results in rubbish strewn across the street by birds and animals. I have been sent a not (see screen grabs in the attachment ) that says the bins are ‘ the responsibility of non-local authority or privately owned/operated organisation.’ Please can you tell me which these ‘non-local authorities and/or private organisations are’ so that I can contact them and ask that the blue bins are removed. Or better still please can you arrange for the blue bins to be removed and preferably replaced with two green bins. Thank you in advance. Regards Sanna

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 83, Balfour Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped dishwasher, 28th June
item.description:
Flytipped dishwasher on the pavement outside 61 Whiteley Road. Unsure whether the owners are expecting the council to collect this but it’s been there for about a week, gets pushed over at night, is an obstruction to pedestrians, and it’s only a matter of time before it gets knocked into a car and causes damage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Whiteley Road, West Norwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet
